attributes.action: Not to purchase a new Royal Yacht
attributes.background: Since Theresa May took office, senior Conservative MPs and ministers - including the Foreign Secretary - have advocated for a new royal yacht to be purchased. We believe this would be a waste of taxpayers' money, and that the government should focus on more important issues facing the UK.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK is facing multiple crises at once - Brexit, Northern Ireland, Scotland, social care, and so on. In the face of these huge challenges, campaigning for money to be diverted to buying a royal yacht is a frivilous gesture. The money would be much better spent on directly addressing those crisis.

Sources - http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2016/10/11/spend-some-of-the-millions-from-the-aid-budget-on-a-new-royal-ya/ 
https://twitter.com/christopherhope/status/841367111104626688

attributes.action: Stop KS1/KS2 SATS criteria discriminating against children with special needs
attributes.background: Current KS1/KS2 SATS criteria state that a child who does not write in the approved way can only be assessed as ‘working towards’ or ‘working at expected’ standards; they cannot be 'working at greater depth’. This discriminates against children with special needs who are unable to write 'joined up'.
attributes.additional_details:
There are no exclusion criteria for children who are unable to write 'joined up', whether because of visual impairment, motor or coordination problems affecting the arms, dyslexia, or other special need.

Full information on the regulations can be found in the Standards & Testing Agency document ‘Clarification: key stage 1 and 2 teacher assessment and moderation guidance’ published in March 2016, downloadable at: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/clarification-key-stage-1-and-2-teacher-assessment-and-moderation-guidance

attributes.action: Cancel HS2 and put the investment in our beleaguered NHS
attributes.background: The Department for Transport says the HS2 project will cut Birmingham-London journey times from 1hr 21min to 49min. Big deal - how about cutting patient waiting times in A&E departments by 32 minutes! Austerity measures should include cancelling non-essential investment - Get the NHS back on track!
attributes.additional_details: According to some experts the estimated cost of HS2 has risen dramatically and could now be as high as £90bn. Why not invest in the NHS and build new efficient world class hospitals. At the same time the government should invest more in recruitment and training of doctors and nurses so that they do not have to work all hours of the day. I have been advised that it takes 7 years to build a new hospital from inception to completion. We need our government to address the shortcomings of the NHS NOW

attributes.action: End industrial breeding of domestic pets to protect the welfare of  animals.
attributes.background:
The Australian Government has just introduced new legislation into Parliament. Their Domestic Animals Act protects the welfare of breeding animals to ensure that their pets come from good homes.
By overhauling the Animal Welfare Act 2006, we in the UK can reform breeding and pet shop industries.
attributes.additional_details:
• Reduce the number of fertile female dogs a breeder can keep.

• Crack down on backyard breeders, so they will have to register with their council as a Domestic Animal Business.

• Establish a Registry of these businesses, giving councils the information to determine who is eligible to register as a breeder and better police the new laws.

• Pet shops will no longer be able to sell puppies and kittens unless they have come from a registered breeder, foster home, animal shelter or charity.

• Foster Carers who look after pets waiting for new homes will have clearer rights and responsibilities – caring for animals without having to register as a Domestic Animal Business, but with the benefit from reduced council registration fees.

attributes.action: Increase Russian sanctions over Chechnya concentration camps & LGBT violations
attributes.background:
Russia is allegedly opening concentration camps in Chechnya into which gay & LGBT community members are being rounded up and forced into. These people are allegedly tortured with electric shocks & beaten, sometimes to death.
We want the UK government to increase sanctions & pressure to stop this.
attributes.additional_details:
News reports claim that LGBT hate is rife in Chechnya with many people too terrified to speak to journalists or human rights groups for fear of punishment. Many also face honour killings from family members. 

Sample news story: https://www.google.co.uk/amp/www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-4397118/amp/Chechnya-opens-concentration-camp-homosexuals.html

attributes.action: Stop GCSE Maths needed for a Level 3 where someone has the SpLD dyscalculia.
attributes.background: How are people with an SpLD supposed to advance in their chosen career if they constantly face hurdles.  They do not get enough support in education as it is without having to face battle after battle.
attributes.additional_details: My 21 year old has a diagnosis of dyscalculia.  At school she got a GCSE Grade E in maths and has no understanding of the subject.  She has a L2 qualification in childcare and wants to progress in her chosen career by taking a L3.  She can begin the course but will not pass until she gets a C in maths. This is discrimination.

attributes.action: Respond to US Executive Order banning people from Muslim countries entering USA
attributes.background: Until the order is revoked, UK must pledge: To call on US govt to reverse the ban; No US-UK government visits; No talks on US-UK trade & migration; Full legal support to UK citizens & businesses affected; To welcome refugees refused entry to USA; To stand up for religious freedom and human rights
attributes.additional_details: On 27 January 2017, US President Donald Trump signed an Executive Order putting in place a 90-day block on entry to the US from citizens from Iran, Iraq, Syria, Yemen, Sudan, Libya and Somalia. The ban applies to those already settled in the US as well as those travelling there, and people in transit (including at least 1 child) have been detained at airports on the US border within 24 hours of signature. UK citizens are also covered by the ban if they are connected with one of these countries.

attributes.action: Discipline and fine MP's who sleep during in session parliamentary proceedings.
attributes.background: As private sector employees would face disciplinary proceedings if they were found to be sleeping on the job, the British government should have rules in place to discipline and substantially fine MP's who sleep on the job.  Numerous photos and videos have emerged of MP's sleeping in parliament.

attributes.action: Create a register/database for any person who changes their name by deed poll
attributes.background:
The National Archives Government website states the following; 
"Contrary to popular belief, it has always been possible to change your name without having to register the change with any official body."
attributes.additional_details:
This hinders Police investigations, particularly when it comes to identity theft, sexual offences, bigamy, tax evasion and tracing missing persons. 
This petition is to request the creation of a database for all changes of name to be recorded on a register similar to that of the Births, Deaths and Marriages. Any persons who wish to not be included on this register must make an application detailing their reasons for the removal which must be authorised by an appropriate person.

attributes.action: STOP the closure of Rotherham main post office
attributes.background:
Rotherham as you know has had bad press,
For the people of  our town many things have disappeared that once made this town a good place to live, buildings pulled down without consulting the people, 
now the main Rotherham post office  (3-5 Bridgegate) is next to be hit,
please put a stop to this.
attributes.additional_details:
this post office is a necessity for the people of Rotherham.
a lot of people including the elderly  use this post office and in turn helps local trade as some have it as part of a day in the town center. it is necessary for passports, driving licenses, pensions ect ect, Rotherham as a town is slowly disappearing and it needs to be stopped, a once proud people are now seeing Rotherham town center disappear, contrary to popular belief not everyone has the internet and still need this post office

attributes.action: Stop new Child Maintenence Service going by Gross income instead of Net income.
attributes.background: The new Child Maintenance Service is now going by gross income instead of fathers actual net pay.
attributes.additional_details: How can the new Child Maintenance Service justify going by gross income instead of net income? How can us fathers pay for our children with money that we do not even receive? I'm all for paying for our children but adding 20% charges on top if you use the collect and pay Service? Not all families have the luxury of their child's mother being co operative and will force you to use CMS. They don't even consider your monthly expenses such as mortgage etc. Please help and get the government to stop this ridiculous change before we all end up homeless and jobless.

attributes.action: Reduce the foreign aid budget for essential services in the UK
attributes.background: Elder care is lacking funding as is the NHS
attributes.additional_details:
The NHS is in dire straits this winter as is the NHS.
If foreign aid money to spurious projects was reduced, more money could be channeled into these vital services.

attributes.action: Eliminate the state pension & benefits to pay for the costs of brexit
attributes.background: It is unfair for the costs of exiting the EU and any financial risk to our economy to be paid for by the young & employed.
attributes.additional_details: The cost of setting up & running the Department of Exiting the EU & any subsequent downturn in the economy should be paid for by eliminating the state pension, job seekers allowance, pension credit etc. Any future downturn in government tax receipts due to recession should be paid for by eliminating these programs before increasing VAT or pay roll taxes.

attributes.action: Remove Prescription Charges for Long-Term Physical/Mental Health Conditions
attributes.background:
In England you pay for prescriptions, unless you have an illness from a special list, or meet other criteria (eg age or max income/assets). This list was set in the 60s; cancer is the only new addition.

We call for those with illnesses lasting 6+ months to get free prescriptions for that illness.
attributes.additional_details:
Around 800,000 people skimp on medication for cost reasons (IPSOS MORI). This raises overall NHS costs. E.g. the cost of an A&E visit for worse asthma exceeds the cost of the drugs. The regime is unfair & out of date, leaving many risking their health.

Further reading: 	
- Gilmore Report: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/prescription-charges-review-the-gilmore-report
- https://www.asthma.org.uk/get-involved/campaigns/our-policy-work/prescription-charges
- http://bit.ly/prescharges

attributes.action: Initiate a national Meningitis B vaccine programme for 14-24 year olds.
attributes.background: Isabel Gentry died from Meningitis B on 20/5/16 aged 16yrs. If Isabel had received the Meningitis B vaccine she would be alive today. This vaccine is only given routinely to babies under 4 months of age. The second most vulnerable age group is the 14 to 24-year-olds.

attributes.action: Introduce a mandatory refresher course and driving test for people over 70
attributes.background:
Far too often we hear of older drivers who have lost control of their car and caused serious damage to themselves and others, sometimes killing people. 

Many know their elderly relatives are no longer fit for driving but are unable to stop them from getting behind a wheel.
attributes.additional_details:
To make our roads safer and help avoid these tragedies we should introduce a mandatory test to make sure drivers are still fit to be on the road. 

These courses, tests and lessons will provide additional income and help protect the public from accidents that could have been avoided.

attributes.action: Save Goldthorpe Job Centre
attributes.background:
Goldthorpe serves approximately 300 claimants. The office serves Bolton on Dearne, Goldthorpe, Thurnscoe, Barnburgh and other smaller hamlets around the Dearne Valley. Claimants will be transferred to Mexborough which for some will mean 2 bus journeys.
It employs 16 staff.
attributes.additional_details:
The proposal will hurt claimants. Claimants will be forced to travel further to get help to look for work. They will be forced to pay more to get help to look for work. Having to travel further will put the most vulnerable at significant risk of sanctions.
The closure will hurt staff. PCS union have identified that staff are being told they must move, lengthened commutes will incur increased travel costs additional car parking costs. extending travel time, impacting on the right to a family life.
The closure will hurt the community. Small local businesses depend on staff and claimants to spend money in order to survive and without this trade will be forced to close.

attributes.action: We call for a special task force to combat 'Post Brexit Hate Crimes'
attributes.background: I have lived in Norwich all my life and later in a small village. Working in the building industry with some of the hardest working EU nationals. I believe every life is precious and we should as good people embrace every human being who wish to embrace our culture.
attributes.additional_details: I am from Norwich which is a lovely City where people got on well, but then come Brexit . I have watched a local Polish shop been burnt out in an arson attack. EU nationals friends can no longer hold their head up and they feel shamed by the nasty finger pointing, racial slurs and agression.

attributes.action: Make St. George's Day a national holiday, countries celebrate their Saint's Day
attributes.background: Now we are going to become an independent country, let's make us great again, and come together to celebrate our Saint George in style, and have a national holiday to celebrate every year, even if we swap it for, say, MAYDAY, bring it forward slightly, or add this in.

attributes.action: Negotiate safe removal of children and pregnant women from Syrian cities
attributes.background: The situation in Syria, particularly in Eastern Aleppo and other areas under siege, continues to deteriorate beyond what is livable. Attempts at peace have failed. We believe that the United Kingdom must lead the way in providing the safe removal of children and pregnant women from these areas.
attributes.additional_details:
Eastern Aleppo's children's hospital has been bombed. Sick children and babies have no place to receive basic care. Other basic resources, such as food, are running out.

The UK understands the importance of removing women and children from cities being bombed, as this was practised during WWII. The situation is even more dire in Syria. We cannot stand by and do nothing. The UK must lead. We mus act now to save these children.

attributes.action: SUSPEND THE £118,000,000.00 GIVEN BY UK TO BURMA THIS YEAR INDEFINITELY
attributes.background:
Britain must save money,especially before uncertain times like BREXIT, when ID CHECKS at hospitals are proposed,the question is,why's BURMA set to receive £118 million from the British taxpayer
when clearly committing crimes against humanity,
and addressing it is the responsibility of all humanity
attributes.additional_details:
PM meeting with Burmese State Counsellor Aung San Suu Kyi: 13/09/16 -Downing Street spokesperson said: "The Prime Minister said we stood ready to provide further assistance as Burma continues to develop, including through £118 million in support this year."

Yale study suggested that the abuse of the more than one million Rohingya may amount to genocide;a confidential United Nations report to the Security Council says it may constitute “crimes against humanity under international criminal law.”

attributes.action: Repeal ALL anti-smoking legislation.
attributes.background: Smoking tobacco is a legal past time, the Government has no legitimate right to restrict a legal activity.  The covering up of cigarettes in shops is ridiculous and counter productive.  Plain packaging does not work.  The high taxation is counter productive and encourages smuggling.

attributes.action: Minimum 5 years in prison for possession of indecent photograph of a child
attributes.background: I think it's very shocking that people found in possession of child porn (criminal justice act 1988 section 160) get maximum of 5 years prison. This should be changed straight away and I think personally they should be locked up for life, but I know this ain't realistic for the government.
attributes.additional_details: This is to out of date and should be changed straight away as well as criminal justice act 1978 section 1

attributes.action: Prevent the sale of painkillers to children
attributes.background: I was unaware until recently that children under 16 could purchase painkillers. I had always assumed you had to be 16. My daughter had purchased paracetamols and took an overdose. Although she is alive an ok I want to prevent the sale of painkillers to under 16's.
attributes.additional_details: I enquired at many shops to see if they had any age restrictions on the sale of paracetamols some did but others did not. Studies show 1-3 children in the classroom are suffering from mental health issues or stress. Being able to purchase painkillers so easy no wonder so many children choose to overdose. My daughter spent 2 weeks in hospital and the amount of children who come in and taken an overdose was worrying. I know this won't stop them trying but we could make the sale less easy.

attributes.action: Make it so that an employer doesn't own privately created work.
attributes.background: I am writing for something I know effects a lot of people, I am trying to help people with ideas be able to use them without being effected by the company they work for. It is currently legal for your employer to own the right to work you created outside of work and not using any company resources.
attributes.additional_details: This is because I feel that people should have the right to own work they created. I myself am one of these people and know a few who are as well and I really want to do all that I can to help make it so that we can reach our full potential without the worry of the company we are working for taking the product as there own.

attributes.action: Immediately review the impact of reforms introduced by the LASPO.
attributes.background: The government has dramatically reduced access to legal aid for tens of thousands of people in civil cases. In doing so it has stripped away a vital element of support for a fair and just legal system. Those hardest hit are some of the most disadvantaged and marginalised people in our society.
attributes.additional_details:
The government has committed to undertaking a wholescale review of the impact of LASPO by April 2018. We support Amnesty's call  for the review to commence immediately and for the government to take steps to ensure the right of the most disadvantaged sectors of society to access justice is adequately protected. 

For more information on the impact of legal aid cuts on access to justice, please see the Amnesty International report here: https://www.amnesty.org/en/documents/eur45/4936/2016/en/

attributes.action: We are asking UK government to impose sanctions on Gabon
attributes.background:
One of the most concerning aspects of the crisis relate to the constant
human rights abuses and violence.    Ali Bongo didn't win the elections in August 2016.
attributes.additional_details: https://eeas.europa.eu/election-observation-missions/eom-gabon/421/election-observation-missions-eueoms_en MEPs question President Bongo’s legitimacy, noting that the official 2016 presidential election results are "non-transparent and highly doubtful". They are deeply concerned about the unfolding violence which followed the proclamation of the results. UK must take up matter and trigger the Cotonou agreement and E.U Resolution on Rule of Law crisis in Gabon adopted on 1st of February 2017.

attributes.action: Regulate vehicle techs to only allow qualified  people to repair motor vehicles
attributes.background: Currently any person can repair  their own or anyone else's vehicle with no training or experience of motor  vehicles. Eg replace their brake with disastrous or fatal results. Other trades are regulated to stop untrained people  from carrying out dangerous  repair work  Eg gas fitters and elections
attributes.additional_details:
Other concerns  are electric  cars
https://www.google.co.uk/amp/www.independent.co.uk/life-style/motoring/motoring-news/electric-cars-mechanics-with-no-specialist-training-risk-death-when-tinkering-with-the-vehicles-a6816786.html%3famp
13% of road accidents are cause by mechanical failure or poorly service vehicles. Regulation  would cut accidents and possibly save lives

attributes.action: Government to pay NHS £5bn Brexit bonus from 2019/20 and every year thereafter.
attributes.background: Now that MP's have voted to trigger Article 50 the Government should stick to the promises made during the Brexit campaign.  Although the well publicised figure of £350m per week isn't realistic I would like to see them pledge a Brexit bonus of £5bn for 2019/20 and every year thereafter.

attributes.action: Don't include housing benefit in the benifits cap
attributes.background: The problem with the benifit cap is that if you are in a private let your weekly rent is much higher than if you are in a council or housing association house some family's could have to pay out as much as £150 a week to make up the short fall leaving many in a very bad situation

attributes.action: Create a constituency with a dedicated MP representing British overseas citizens
attributes.background: Over 5 million citizens live outside of the UK, a large number of which cannot vote as they have been resident abroad for 15 years or more. Moreover, British citizens are not represented in Parliament. Democratically, over 5 million citizens abroad should be represented by at least one MP.
attributes.additional_details:
Other countries have created constituencies outside of their national borders, with representation in Parliament through one or more dedicated MPs. 
With over 5 million British citizens abroad, of whom a majority is not allowed to vote due to the 15 years residency restriction, it would be democratic to at least ensure that this significant proportion of British citizens is duly represented in Parliament.

attributes.action: Dogs to be kept on leads whilst on sports fields
attributes.background:
On ongoing issue in our society is dog walkers allowing their dogs to run freely over sporting pitches, i.e rugby, football, cricket...
At times these dogs will release on the pitches and owners will ignore the excrement and not pick it up, thus providing a huge risk to those who play on them
attributes.additional_details:
Sporting pitches experience usage from a variety of different people - the problem of dog walkers allowing their dogs to be off their lead is that they are free to excrement wherever, the majority of the time, without the owner knowing.
The danger of this on sporting pitches is that it increases the risk of a child or adult getting the faeces in their eyes leading to several physical and health risks such as going blind.

Please help stop this and provide some respect for our sportsman.

attributes.action: Preserve the UK bat population by banning wind farms
attributes.background: All species of UK bats are protected by the law. Wind farms are killing thousands of them each year.Bats have been around for 30 million years able to fly without the risk of colliding with spinning objects. They deactivate their sonar when near turbines and are attracted to the bugs drawn to them.
attributes.additional_details:
At 29 of the 46 UK wind farms examined 194 were killed monthly- a likely gross underestimate. Carried over to the 6,954 onshore turbines the carnage is tens of thousands.
Dr Lintott suggests turning off turbines during high risk periods. 
On October 2016 227 megawatts (just 0.6% of the 36,759 mW being used) was from turbines, 70%from coal; 21% nuclear; 8% from abroad.
We need forms of reliable renewable energy to deliver electricity at competitive prices that do not devastate the bat population.

attributes.action: Make health warnings compulsory on processed meat.
attributes.background: Since the world health authority classified processed meat as class one carcinogen to humans. (Definitely causes cancer.) There should be health warnings placed on all packaging, in the same way the warnings have to be on cigarettes.
attributes.additional_details: Class 1 carcinogen = definitely causes cancer in humans as classified by WHO.

attributes.action: Stop schools from giving awards for 100% attendance.
attributes.background: Schools often issue awards for children who attain 100% attendance. Apart from the fact that this discriminates against many children who have medical appointments which cannot be arranged out of term time, absence from school for certain illnesses is required, making 100% attendance impossible.
attributes.additional_details: Many of the childhood illnesses children contract are caught from their classmates, at school. Many of these illnesses, such as chicken pox, rotavirus and impetigo, require children to be absent from school for a minimum period of time before returning. This means the 100% attendance award is an impossibility and awarding it to children who have somehow managed not to suffer from these illnesses throughout the school year makes other children feel inadequate. It's discriminatory and must stop.

attributes.action: Prioritise the building of new social housing to help solve the housing crisis.
attributes.background: Many people in their 20's, 30's and 40's are forced to live in private rental accommodation that is costing them a fortune and that in some cases is not fit for purpose. They are also being forced out of the areas they grew up in due to the high cost of housing.
attributes.additional_details: By building more social housing with affordable rents, prioritised for local people, areas can retain there unique cultures. This will also reduce rents for private tenants as demand is reduced, due to people having social housing available. In the longer term, house prices will then reduce as demand from landlords for properties they can rent out is reduced as they get less return on their investment. Private builders cant solve the crisis but councils can with social housing.

attributes.action: Stop the Deportation of Sikhs and Hindus to the Islamic Republic of Afghanistan
attributes.background: While the 2004 constitution of Afghanistan allows for religions other than Islam to freely exercise their faith within the limits of the law in reality Afghan Sikhs and Hindu’s continue to face harassment and violence. on 29/12/2016 an Afghan Sikh head was shot five times, also previously targeted.
attributes.additional_details: As community size shrinks Sikhs&Hindus are finding themselves vulnerable to exploitation against which they have no defence. Dr Guiztozzi states that the reported attacks and harassment amount to a very serious threat thus 99.99% of the Minority group have opted to abandon their property and flee. Therefore, considering the small size (0.01% from 32m people) of the community prevalent & the sample episodes of abuse & harassment indicates high level of pressure on the Sikh and Hindu Community

attributes.action: Put a stop to Annualised/Banked Hours contracts in workplaces.
attributes.background: The government needs to abolish the Banked/Annualised Hours contracts in workplaces. Employees are working over the working time directive, where the additional overtime is banked. This should be paid at a normal or premium rate as standard.
attributes.additional_details: Employees who work under this scheme have to constantly monitor hours that are either "Banked" or "Owed". Sometimes working unsociable hours, or days where the employer will then tactically either stand down employee from shift to ensure further hours are not "Banked", or put unreasonable requests to employees to make up hours "owed".

attributes.action: Amend the curriculum to include race relations as a compulsory area of study.
attributes.background: The state of race relations in the UK (and Europe) is worse than it has ever been during the course of my life. The concept of racial equality and appreciation of other religions, cultures and ethnicities must be taught from primary school onwards, so as to ensure that the UK operates harmoniously.
attributes.additional_details: Racial divide and the concept of the 'foreign other' is not natural. No child is born to notice that others are of a different skin tone to them - it is something that society engrains in us over time. Children must be taught that we are all equal for this country to truly prosper and lead from the front. Almost all hate crimes could be avoided if people were taught about racial equality from primary school onwards. The PM must be more proactive and not shirk her responsibility in this regard.

attributes.action: British Government to reconsider its decision to renew the Lease on Chagos
attributes.background: The British Government decided to stop resettlement of the Chagossians. The Government should stop the renewal of the Lease in December 2016. If proceeds the natives would be too old or be dead in 2036, when  the lease expires.  Exiled for over 40 years. Join me in condemning this decision.
attributes.additional_details: The British Government has recently made £40M available in a pot to assist the Chagossians over the next 10 years. The sum is not sufficient to redress the wrong-doings by the Government and instead a more legitimate programme for resettlement of the Chagossians should be considered, wherever the Chagossians are today, irrespective of their current circumstances.  All the Chagossians HAVE BEEN UPROOTED and therefore should EACH be treated equally in benefiting from any form of redress.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of energy drinks to children under 18
attributes.background: The World Health Organisation carried out a review of the literature surrounding energy drinks & found most of potential health risks are related to the caffeine content. In Sweden they are restricted to being sold in pharmacies & are not sold to under 15's.
attributes.additional_details: This information came from NHS choices 2014 (warnings issued over energy drinks) They are likely to become a serious public health issue in the future if they are not more heavily regulated.

attributes.action: Make political education a compulsory lesson in schools
attributes.background: I am an 18 year old who has been shocked with the political results in 2016. Many have complained that recent referendum and election results are due to uneducated voters. Politics affects everyone, so why is it that not everyone understands or it taught about it?
attributes.additional_details: Not once in my education have I ever had a politics lesson. Even though I didn't choose to study this subject at a level, I am interested in it and feel it is vital that every student has a basic understanding of it. By scheduling compulsory political lessons for everyone you are telling young people that it matters and that their vote matters. Lack of education leads people to make uninformed choices that can have a huge effect on the end result. Let's end uneducated votes.

attributes.action: Implement a 12 month ban for using mobiles while driving.
attributes.background: Far too many people are still ignoring the fact that people are being injured and killed daily due to mobile phone distraction behind the wheel. If you get caught driving and using your phone you should face the same punishment as drink drivers and be banned from driving for 12 months.
attributes.additional_details:
More than 500,000 drivers still using mobile phones at wheel, study shows
At least one in 20 drivers aged under 30 have been caught flouting the law 
Report said using hand-held device is more dangerous than drink or drugs
In 2013, mobile phone use behind the wheel was factor in 22 fatal collisions


Read more: http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/

attributes.action: Introduce a law that enforces companies to grant menstrual leave to women
attributes.background: Most times, high menstrual pains may bring about heightened exhaustion, reduced proficiency, and expression of emotional uneasiness. The pain can be so intense sometimes that it might require urgent medical attention.Policies that grant workers paid sick leaves would help to solve these problems.

attributes.action: Stop sending foreign aid to countries that have space programmes
attributes.background: UK currently sends 0.7% of GPA as foreign aid to some countries which have space programmes such as India and China when our own public services are at breaking point. This should be reduced and the savings put into our own NHS and other public services. Countries receiving should be developing ones
attributes.additional_details:
British ambassador in China is currently inviting the elderly in China to apply for a grant from the foreign aid fund of 1.3 billion, a country that spends billions on aspace programme and has one of the largest acconamy in the world.
UK sends millions to India and Pakistan every year in foreign aid when they also have space programmes.
At a time of austerity this money should be spent on public services here in the UK

attributes.action: Pass a law to remove the Speaker of the House of Commons during a Parliament
attributes.background: A Speaker to the House of Commons cannot  be removed during the term of Parliament. This petition is to pass a law to enable Parliament to remove a Speaker during a Parliament if they harm the National Interest.

attributes.action: Amend the Criminal Justice Act 1988 to allow ambulance staff to carry batons
attributes.background: In 2014/15 there were 1861 reported assaults on emergency ambulance staff. Staff must be authorised to carry telescopic batons to defend themselves from attackers, as we have no means of currently doing so. A specific defence must be made for staff to be in possession in the course of their duties.
attributes.additional_details: Currently, Section 139 of the Criminal Justice Act 1988 states it is an offence "of having an offensive weapon in a public place without lawful authority or reasonable excuse and having an article with blade or sharply pointed in a public place without lawful authority or good reason". Currently there are 3 specific defences. A specific defence must be added stating that ambulance staff, in the course of their duties may be in possession of a telescopic baton for the purpose of defence of life.

attributes.action: Make euthanasia legal in the UK in cases of Terminal illnesses & suffering
attributes.background: I've got end stage liver disease. Knowing the death I was facing I've  tried to euthanise myself lots in the last 2 years, almost successful, but sadly not. I'm now using up a bed at a Mental health rehab unit cos they have to protect me from myself, even though it's not a MH issue, & suffering
attributes.additional_details: If an animal was suffering with the pain & symptoms I, and many others are going through daily, keeping the animal alive would result in prosecution for cruelty. We allow animals dignity in dying, so why do we not offer this option, with extremely stringent procedures in place to protect the vulnerable, to fellow humans? I wanted to just fall asleep, instead I'm being forced to suffer Hepatic Encephalopathy & extreme pain, both of which are extremely distressing. Please help change the law!

attributes.action: Stop Immigration Skills Surcharge for the sake of our UK healthcare system
attributes.background: The Home Office are planning to charge £1000 per worker, per year to every employer who recruits an overseas worker. Our healthcare system is in crisis and with additional financial constraints such as this surcharge will see our healthcare system in even more trouble.
attributes.additional_details: As a country we are thousands of nurses short. The cost of overseas recruitment of highly skilled nurses is already a huge cost to our NHS and private sector. Additional surcharges will hinder the affordability of recruiting desperately needed staff. The Government have suggested this will aid UK employers to train and recruit british staff. Students are not choosing nursing as a career path due to many factors. Without highly skilled nurses, lives are increasingly at risk!

attributes.action: Ban Sodium Fluoride from our tap water
attributes.background: Sodium Fluoride is not natural, it is man made. Do not get this mixed up with calcium fluoride which is natural and can be found in soil. Sodium fluoride has not been scientificly tested for long term affects or if it even helps prevent tooth decay like we get told it does.
attributes.additional_details: Fluoride has been seen to cause alot of diseases such as cancer. https://fluoridealert.org/issues/health/ check it out for yourselves via the link above. Sodium fluoride is mostly found in the pineal gland after being indigested, which leads to a lowered IQ of the person consuming it. Unfortunately, the damaged caused by sodium fluoride can not be reversed. However we can stop making it worse and avoid the affects by stopping drinking it everyday in our tap water.
